III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Around 4/2/24, youth was trying to take a staff member's walkie
talkie and the staff member yelled for help. Another staff member
came and slammed the youth to the ground causing youth to hit
the back of the left side of their head on the wall. Youth was
restrained in a prone position on the ground. Youth reported laying
face down for 5 minutes and had trouble breathing. Youth reports
being sore on the back of their head.
Investigation Interviews
I spoke with Complainant on 04/04/2024 at Wolverine Center.
Complainant did not have additional information.
I interviewed Youth A on 04/04/2024 at Wolverine Center with
Department of Health and Human Service Worker 1 and
Department of Health and Human Service Worker 2. Youth A
stated he tried multiple times to take Staff Person 1’s radio, which
was clipped to her jeans at the waistband. Youth A stated Staff
Person 1 redirected him to stop and not touch Staff Person 1’s
radio. Youth A stated Staff Person 1 yelled for help when he
continued to try to take her radio. Youth A stated Staff Person 2
came to the second-floor alcove and restrained Youth A to the
ground. Youth A could not provide details of the restraint. Youth A
stated he hit the back, left side of his head on the wall when he
went to the ground on his side. Youth A stated his head was sore,
but he did not have a bump or cut on his head. Youth A stated he
was taken to Beaumont Hospital and received a head x-ray and
throat swab. Youth A stated Staff Person 1 was the only witness
to this restraint.
I interviewed Staff Person 1 on 04/12/2024 at Wolverine Center
with Department of Health and Human Service Worker 3. Staff
Person 1 stated Youth A tried to take the radio away from her on
multiple occasions. Staff Person 1 stated Youth A succeeded one
time in taking her radio, which was clipped to the front pocket of
her pants. Staff Person 1 stated Youth A grabbed the radio,
played and sang on it, and refused to give it back. Staff Person 1
2

stated she regained the radio when Youth A dropped it on the
ground. Staff Person 1 stated Staff Person 2 verbally redirected
Youth A to step back when Youth A tried to grab the radio again.
Staff Person 1 stated Staff Person 2 stood face to face with Youth
A and they went to the ground on their sides. Staff Person 1
stated Youth A started to cry and asked to go to the hospital
because he hit his head against the wall. Staff Person 1 stated
she did not see how Staff Person 2 and Youth A fell to the ground,
but does not recall Staff Person 1 holding Youth A on the ground.
Staff Person 1 stated Youth A was transported to the hospital for
an evaluation.
I interviewed Staff Person 2 on 04/12/2024 at Wolverine Center
with Department of Health and Human Service Worker 3. Staff
Person 2 stated he saw a staff radio on the floor in the second-
floor alcove while Staff Person 3 talked with Youth A. Staff Person
2 stated he stepped towards Youth A when Youth A tried to have
physical contact with Staff Person 1, who was also in the second-
floor alcove. Staff Person 2 stated Youth A stood with his back
towards the wall and Youth A went to the ground on his own,
twisted around on the ground, and hit the back of his head against
the base of the wall. Staff Person 2 stated he crouched down on
his hands and knees to assist Youth A up, but immediately stood
up when Youth A said he hit his head against the wall. Staff
Person 2 denied physically managing Youth A. Staff Person 2
stated Youth A went to the hospital for an evaluation.
I interviewed Staff Person 3 on 04/16/2024 by phone. Staff
Person 3 stated Youth A wanted to play cards with a female staff
person (does not recall who), but the female staff person was
completing paperwork. Staff Person 3 stated he offered to play
cards with Youth A or go outside with Youth A, but Youth A
refused. Staff Person 3 stated Youth A tried to take the female
staff person’s radio and told Staff Person 3 to “Shut the fuck up
bitch” when redirected to allow the female staff person to finish her
paperwork. Staff Person 3 stated Youth A tried multiple times to
take the female staff person’s radio. Staff Person 3 stated Staff
Person 2 attempted to place Youth A in a seated child restraint
hold when Youth A took hold of the female staff person’s radio
that was attached to her pant pocket. Staff Person 3 stated the
attempted seated child restraint lasted for two to five seconds.
Staff Person 3 stated Youth A sat on the floor, cried and said, “I
don’t want to be here. I want to go to the hospital.” Staff Person 3
stated he did not witness Youth A hit his head against the wall, but
Youth A complained of a headache and was sent to the hospital
for an evaluation.
3

Documentation:
• Incident report dated 03/30/2024 at 7:15 PM states Youth A
tried to engage Staff Person 1 in a fight for not playing a
card game with him. It states Staff Person 1 asked Youth A
to wait until she completed her paperwork. It states Staff
Person 3 asked Youth A to play cards until Staff Person 1
was available to play cards with him. It states Youth A
became angry and tried to take Staff Person 1’s radio. It
states after multiple redirection Youth A was placed in a
seated position for five seconds.
• Youth A’s Beaumont discharge paperwork states Youth A
was seen on 03/30/2024. It states Youth A received Strep-
throat test, Covid-19 test and CT head imaging test. Youth
A was diagnosed with sore throat and minor head injury
(bump on the head from a fall or accident).
• Staff Person 2 was hired in 05/2023. Staff Person 2 was
last trained in Nonviolent Crisis Physical Intervention on
12/05/2023. Staff Person 2 is no longer employed at
Wolverine Center effective 04/12/2024.
• Staff Person 3 was hired in 02/2024. Staff Person 3 was
last trained in Nonviolent Crisis Physical Intervention in
03/04/2024.
Tour Observation:
Upon entering the second-floor one stands in the hallway. Directly
to the left is a multi-purpose room. Individual youth bedrooms line
the hallway to the right and to the left. A desk is located in the
alcove in the middle of the hallway to the left. Perpendicular to this
hallway are more youth bedrooms and the unit bathroom.
Video:
Second-floor alcove area does not have a video camera.
Analysis It cannot be determined based on the lack of details from Youth A,
conflicting staff interviews, and lack of video if Youth A hit his head
on the wall on his own or due in part to Staff Person 2’s
intervention with Youth A.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
